alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:55AM EST until January 11 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting Stafford, City of Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania independent cities. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg. * WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, A home on River Road on the Stafford County side of the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 09/20/2003. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 MSG unknown 16.6 17.0 16.0 17.0 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
